page.title: 01Introduction to 03760396
page.content: This area is cut by the Manchester Ship Canal and the Bridgewater Canal. To the south is Trafford Park, once the most famous industrial estate in Europe. Since the Second World War the area has declined. Nowadays the estate is being replanned and rebuilt with new roads and a change to modern industry, including newspaper printing (The Daily Telegraph), all focussing on the M63 instead of the railway and the canal. In the southeast corner, there is a small area of housing, shops and schools built to cater for estate workers. North of the canal there is dense industrial housing which includes the ancient settlement of Eccles and its nineteenth century industrial off-shoot, Patricroft. Here, derelict housing is being replaced by new housing.
